Name: MMR to report on the allocation of funds and provision of services for each agency, where applicable.
Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report and the Mayor’s Management Report to report on the allocation of funds and provision of services for each agency, where applicable, geographically by census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
Section 1.  Paragraphs 3 and 4 of subdivision b of section 12 of the charter of the city of New York are amended, and paragraph 5 and 6 are hereby added, to read as follows:
(3) an explanation in narrative and/or tabular form of significant changes in the program performance goals and measures from the adopted budget condition to the current budget as modified and from said modified budget to the preliminary budget statements;[ and] 
(4) an appendix indicating the relationship between the program performance goals and measures included in the management report pursuant to paragraph two of this subdivision and the corresponding appropriations contained in the preliminary budget[.];
(5) a report detailing the geographic distribution of funding allocations, where applicable, based upon census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough; and
(6) a report detailing the geographic distribution of services provided, where applicable, based upon census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough. 
	§2. Paragraphs 5 and 6 of subdivision c of section 12 of the charter of the city of New York are amended, and paragraph 7 and 8 are hereby added, to read as follows:
	(5) a summary of the procurement actions taken during the previous fiscal year, including: (i) for each of the procurement methods specified in section three hundred twelve, the number and dollar value of the procurement contracts entered into during such fiscal year; and (ii) for all procurement contracts entered into pursuant to a procurement method other than that specified in paragraph one of subdivision a of section three hundred twelve, the number and dollar value of such procurement contracts by each of the reasons specified in paragraph one of subdivision b of section three hundred twelve;[ and]
	(6) an appendix indicating the relationship between the program performance goals included in the management report pursuant to paragraph two of this subdivision and the corresponding expenditures made pursuant to the adopted budget for the previous fiscal year[.];
(7) a report detailing the geographic distribution of funding allocations, where applicable, based upon census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough; and
	(8) a report detailing the geographic distribution of services provided, where applicable, based upon census tract, zip code, community district, council district and borough. 
	§3. This local law shall take effect sixty days after its enactment.
